x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
TechBloom creates a digital ecosystem that connects schools, mentors, and tech organizations to support girls’ participation in STEM from an early age.
Through workshops, coding challenges, and virtual mentorships, girls gain practical tech experience and exposure to innovation projects.
Organizations and educators can track learning progress, engagement, and career pathways — helping build a more inclusive tech future.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Young women and girls, especially in developing regions, face limited access to STEM education, mentorship, and real-world tech exposure. This lack of early encouragement and infrastructure contributes to the underrepresentation of women in science, technology, and innovation-driven industries.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: TechBloom: Empowering the Next Generation of Women Innovators
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine Studio - build learning pathways, challenge leaderboards, and mentor matching.

Now Learning / Knowledge Management - host courses, tech guides, and success stories.

Performance Analytics - track participant growth, engagement rates, and STEM progression.

Flow Designer - automate mentorship assignments and workshop scheduling.

IntegrationHub - connect to coding platforms (e.g., GitHub, Code.org) and education APIs.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with learning management systems (LMS).
  • Cloud storage for student projects and achievements.
  • AI-based recommendation engine for mentorship matching.
  • Mobile-first design for easy access in low-resource regions.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Sustaining long-term engagement beyond initial programs.
  • Ensuring access to devices and internet in underserved areas.
  • Encouraging cross-sector collaboration between schools and tech firms.
